sections.name: Narlynark
sections.text: This creature did not include a description.

link.name: Crown of the Kobold King pg. 106

link.name: Crown of the Kobold King pg. 106
link.alt: Crown of the Kobold King pg. 106

traits.name: Unique
traits.text: A rules element with this trait is one-of-a-kind. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to creatures with this trait is increased by 10.

traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

traits.name: Humanoid
traits.text: Humanoid creatures reason and act much like humans. They typically stand upright and have two arms and two legs.

traits.name: Kobold
traits.text: A creature with this trait is a member of the kobold ancestry. Kobolds are reptilian humanoids who are usually Small and typically have darkvision. An ability with this trait can be used or selected only by kobolds.

link.name: Crown of the Kobold King pg. 106
link.alt: Crown of the Kobold King pg. 106

modifiers.name: wand of spider climb made from a giant spider's foot

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Finesse
traits.text: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls using this melee weapon. You still use your Strength modifier when calculating damage.

traits.name: Trip
traits.text: You can use this weapon to Trip with the Athletics skill even if you don't have a free hand. This uses the weapon's reach (if different from your own) and adds the weapon's item bonus to attack rolls as an item bonus to the Athletics check. If you critically fail a check to Trip using the weapon, you can drop the weapon to take the effects of a failure instead of a critical failure.

ability.name: Wild Retreat

traits.name: Move
traits.text: An action with this trait involves moving from one space to another.

traits.name: Primal
traits.text: This magic comes from the primal tradition, connecting to the natural world and instinct. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Transmutation
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the transmutation school of magic, typically changing something’s form.

ability.requirement: Narlynark is adjacent to at least one enemy
ability.effect: Narlynark shrieks in terror, a sound that quickly transitions from a kobold cry to the shrill cry of a bird. A pair of feathery wings grows from his back and his feet turn into bird talons. As he leaps into the air to flee, his talons lash out—one adjacent enemy of Narlynark's choice takes 3d6+6 slashing damage (DC 22 basic Reflex save). Narlynark can then fly up to 35 feet away. He must end his movement in a space that isn't adjacent to any enemies, and if he doesn't end the movement on the ground, he falls to the ground as his wings vanish and his feet return to normal.
